intro: Solanum aculeatissimum var. denudatum, commonly known as the naked-stem nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically white or pale green. The plant produces small, globose berries that are yellow when mature. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its toxic properties. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in warm climates.
